adjective.description: Of, relating to, or designating an era following the Palaeozoic era, comprising both the Mesozoic and Cenozoic (Cainozoic) eras.
Frequently with the. Of, belonging to, or designating the most recent era; = "Cainozoic".

noun.description: The Neozoic era; the rocks collectively dating from this time.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Edward Forbes (1815–1854), natural historian. From neo- + -zoic, after Palaeozoic.
